content:
As far as I can tell, Barrel hasn't been updated since March and the master branch has been left in a state that doesn't even compile at the moment (I opened this PR back in March to fix it https://github.com/rust-db/barrel/pull/95 but there's been no traction so far). I guess I've got a number of questions...

Are there plans to maintain it? Are there future plans for improvements? Are there issues with the API which would make building something to replace it a better option?
I also want to contribute some stuff to it, but I am waiting for diesel 2.0 to be done
@spacekookie might answer your question @Kaleb Elwert

Hey there. It's been a while :sweat_smile: I indeed didn't really maintain barrel in 2020. I've recently merged some PRs and fixed some code. I don't know if I'll have the time and energy to get back to the project but the goal _is_ to cut a release with the fixes and finally implement a few features in the test harness that will make the library much more dependable
